title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.4 NUTRITION SERVICE DELIVERY

description.narrative: Output 1.4 More children, adolescents, and women, benefit from improved and equitable use of high-impact maternal, new-born, child, and adolescent nutrition-specific and sensitive interventions, which contributes to Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, more vulnerable neonates, infants and children survive and thrive and fewer women die during pregnancy and childbirth

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.4 More children, adolescents, and women, benefit from improved and equitable use of high-impact maternal, new-born, child,and adolescent nutrition-specific and sensitive interventions

description.narrative: With UNICEF support, nutrition programme coverage significantly improved to 91% in 2021.A total of 273,049 children with SAM were enrolled in mobile and fixed OTPs representing an achievement of 85% of the UNICEF target. This achievement was due to establishment of 342 new OTPs in 2021. In addition, up to 7 million children were screened in various platforms in 2021. The performance indicatorsfor the treatment of SAM programme was above the acceptable SPHERE standards at 88.5%.A total of 1,680,171 (137%) pregnant and lactating women received iron folate supplementation while 3,013,858 (175%) women have benefitted from IYCF consultations | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/01/2022
